e4: Changing to the new policy enhances transparency and ethical standards by ensuring reported earnings reflect the true financial position of the company. This reduces legal risks associated with biased reporting and fosters greater trust among investors. Over time, clearer communication around the policy shift will help investors adjust and properly value the company's stock.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and honesty, presenting financial data objectively without intentional biases. It should ensure investors have a clear, unambiguous understanding of the company's financial health. The policy should comply with legal regulations, safeguarding against misrepresentation, and should consider the equitable treatment of all investors, ensuring no group is unduly advantaged by insider knowledge.
e6: Yes, I would ask: How do we plan to communicate the policy change clearly to ensure all investors understand it fully? What measures can we implement to mitigate any potential stock price volatility during the transition? Also, how will this change impact our relationships with current institutional investors?"
